text: Gary Gensler (born October 18, 1957) is an American businessman and politician. He was the 33rd Chair of the Securities and Exchange Commission from April 17, 2021 until January 20, 2025. Gensler was the 11th chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission under President Barack Obama from May 26, 2009 to January 3, 2014. He was the Under Secretary of the Treasury for Domestic Finance from 1999 to 2001. Gensler was the Assistant Secretary of the Treasury for Financial Markets from 1997 to 1999. On January 12, 2021, then President-elect Joe Biden nominated Gensler to be the 33rd Chair of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. On April 14, 2021, his nomination was confirmed in the Senate by a vote of 53â€“45."On the Nomination (Confirmation: Gary Gensler, of Maryland, to be a Member of the Securities and Exchange Commission)" United States Senate, April 14, 2021 ==References== Category:1957 births Category:Living people Category:Members of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission Category:Businesspeople from Baltimore Category:Politicians from Baltimore Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Gary Gensler
